Largest Mw is the 1977 Mw 8.3 event. Slip rate based on the assumption that the moment rate is ~ 0.5% of that for the sunda Arc [J.G. based on Sleep (2012)]
Note that the Berryman et al (2015) ‘Timor’ is not this place, but more the western end of our ‘flores’ source
Default coupling. Slip rate from JG.  Mw_max_min from ISC-GEM catalogue.
Mw_max_min from inversion reported in Griffin et al (2015), Evaluation of onshore digital elevation models for …; Slip nominal value based on J.G. traces but note substantial spatial variability

Slip-rate based on J.G. traces. Note GEM’s historical earthquake archive suggests an Mw 8.8 here in 1629, whereas Liu and Harris (2013) put it further east around Seram
